124332122122211.title: Return to normal

1243321221222112.content:
"I just want to switch back," Danny said. "This has all just been too weird."

"That's fine, hon," Jasmine said. "Go get the remote. I think I want to stay as Kim a little while longer, but we can switch you back to normal right now."

"Thanks for understanding," Danny said. He jumped up from the couch and ran to Jasmine's room. He returned a moment later with the purse he'd taken to the club last night. Reaching into the purse, he felt around for the remote... but he didn't find anything that felt like the remote. Lifting the purse a little higher and tilting it into the morning sunlight that fell in through the window, he looked inside, scanned the entire purse for the remote. "Uh..."

"What?" Jasmine said.

Danny turned the purse upside down, he dumped its contents out on the couch. He sorted through every item carefully, but he couldn't... find... the remote...

"I... I think I lost the remote," Danny said hoarsely.

Jasmine's eyes flew wide open, and she stared in disbelief for a moment. "You... what?"

"The remote, it was in here last time I looked, but it's not here anymore. I've looked through every inch of this purse, I swear..."

"Are you sure it was in the purse?"

"I'm sure," Danny said. "I put it in my... err, your purse last night in case we wanted to use it at the club. I haven't used it since then. There's nowhere else it would be..."

Jasmine sat down heavily on the couch. "Danny... you had what may well be the most powerful device in the whole universe in your hands... and you LOST it? How does that happen?"

"I don't know," Danny said. He sighed and thought back over the previous night, trying in his panic to think how he might have lost the remote. Then it struck him. "The guy who hit on me... I think he stole it!"

"What?" Jasmine said.

"He had his arm around me, see," Danny said, reaching out his arm and trying to reenact the event, "and I had the purse on my other side. And he was talking to me, and I was so freaked out that I wasn't paying any attention to the purse. I'm sure he could have taken it."

Jasmine slapped her face and groaned. "Danny, you idiot!" she said. "He was a thief? And you let him STEAL the remote? You weren't paying closer attention to it? Do you realize how stupid..."

"Hey, I was drunk," Danny cut in. "Cut me a little slack. And besides, he was a GUY, and he was HITTING on me. Do you realize how creepy that was?"

Jasmine let out an exasperated scream. "Danny. I've been trying to be nice, but... you're a girl now. You realize that, right? You're a girl, and a pretty hot one at that, if I do say so myself. Girls get hit on by guys. That's the way the world works. And you were dressed pretty sexy last night. That guy, he didn't see you as Danny... he saw you as me. Guys try to pick me up all the time. And we were in a club... that's what people do in clubs. What did you expect?"

"I..."

"I mean, seriously, Danny. I get why you were freaked out, I do. But you had to know you were going to get hit on by some guys. If you didn't, you were being stupid."

"But... he hit on me..." Danny said weakly.

Jasmine put her hands in her face and let out a deep sigh. "Okay. Do you remember what the guy looked like?"

"Uh..." Danny tried hard to remember. "Um, he was black..."

"And?"

"Uh... and... he was tall, I guess, and... look, I said, I was drunk, all right? And I wasn't really paying attention to what he looked like..."

Jasmine rolled her eyes. "Okay. Maybe we can find him some other way. I'm... I'm going to think about it..."

"Maybe we can talk it over," Danny said.

"Look, Danny," Jasmine said. "I don't think I can be in this room with you right now, okay?" She got to her feet. "I'm gonna go jogging. We'll talk about this later."

Danny watched dejectedly as Jasmine left the house.

12433212212221122.content:
As Jasmine's feet tracked over the pavement beneath her, she began to feel her muscles slowly unwind. She enjoyed jogging; it was her favorite way of dealing with stress. Not that she'd ever been all that good at it; she wasn't all that fast or all that fit. But it made her feel better, and that was what mattered.

Maybe she'd been too hard on Danny. He was just a high school kid, and he seemed like a pretty sheltered one at that. Did he really not believe he was going to have guys hit on him? Could he really be that naive? Maybe... maybe he just hadn't thought through all the implications of being a woman. It had struck her as odd, when he'd first asked her to swap, that Danny would want to be a woman... what kind of teenage boy would want to be a woman, after all? Obviously Danny wasn't gay, judging from the way he'd reacted to that guy last night... or if he was, he was pretty deep in the closet. And surely it wasn't because he thought he would be treated better as a woman... young or not, Danny had to know the kind of discrimination women faced. Was it some kind of fetish thing? If so, it seemed like a pretty weird fetish. Maybe Danny was a crossdresser? He hadn't seemed to mind getting all dressed up in Jasmine's clothing, so maybe. Or maybe... maybe it wasn't being a woman that Danny was interested in at all. Maybe he just wanted to try on a more glamorous life for a while. Jasmine didn't exactly consider herself glamorous... but she thought back to when she'd been an awkward, frustrated teenager Danny's age. She would have killed to be out of high school, to be away from her parents and all the restrictions they placed on her. To be out in the world, living her own life... partying every weekend the way she and Kim and Veronica did now. And besides, Jasmine was a good-looking woman... she knew that. So maybe, to a kid like Danny, her life was glamorous. And maybe Danny had just wanted to experience that for a little while.

Still, Danny had been stupid. Even putting aside his hysterical freakout over that guy who'd tried to hit on him, Danny had been careless with the remote, and in the process, he had lost it, maybe for good. And that meant Jasmine and Danny both were trapped in their current lives, and poor Kim was stuck thinking she was a teenage boy. Jasmine had wanted to try on Kim's life for a while, sure, but she didn't want to be Kim forever... and she didn't want to just hand over her life to someone else. It was her life... it belonged to her, and she wanted to be able to live it herself. And besides all that, the remote was now in the hands of someone who was sketchy enough to steal it... who knew what he would do with it? Danny was a good kid; Jasmine knew that. He was nice and smart and well-intentioned, and Jasmine found that she was fond of him even despite the trouble he'd caused. But that didn't excuse him for losing the remote.

Not that being Kim didn't have its advantages. One day in, Jasmine was still enjoying Kim's life. She wouldn't have wanted to give it back to Kim yet if she'd had the choice. Kim was gorgeous, she was charismatic, her parents were wealthy, she had an awesome wardrobe, and she was a very successful pre-law student. Who wouldn't want her life? And besides that, she was athletic... Jasmine was only beginning to realize how athletic her friend was, now that she was literally running around in her shoes. Jasmine would have felt winded long before now if she'd still been herself, but as Jasmine, she was still going strong. Just as Danny had retained all of Jasmine's driving skills and her experience walking in high heels, Jasmine must have inherited Kim's athletic ability.

As she turned a corner, Jasmine saw Mr. Fredericks in his driveway washing his car. Jasmine always hated this part of her jog. Mr Fredericks was a creepy old man. He was very unfriendly, and he always had a sneer for Jasmine as she ran or walked by. He seemed like a bitter old loner, and Jasmine always felt thoroughly unwelcome as she went by, like he wanted her out of the neighborhood. Jasmine felt a little sorry for him... a guy like that, he couldn't have many friends, and it had to be a sad, lonely life.

To her surprise, though, as Jasmine ran past, Mr. Fredericks looked up and gave her a smile and a wave. "Good morning, Kim," he said as she ran past. Jasmine's head spun.. what was that all about? She'd never seen Mr. Fredericks smile, and she'd barely even heard him say a word, especially a friendly one. Why was he being so friendly this morning? Had he gotten laid last night.

No... no, Jasmine realized, with slow-dawning comprehension, what had just happened. Mr. Fredericks wasn't a grumpy old man... he was a racist. He was a racist, and so he didn't like Jasmine, didn't like the thought of an African-American girl in his neighborhood. This was a very white neighborhood, after all, and Jasmine had long suspected she was the only black person here. To Mr. Fredericks, Jasmine was an unwelcome intruder. But as Kim... as Kim, she was white. Or at least, everyone believed she was white, even though her skin was as brown as ever. But thanks to the remote, just as everyone saw Danny as a woman, they saw Jasmine as being Kim's particularly pale shade of white.

That was a strange thought. Jasmine had grown up in a racist little town in the Midwest. Her family was the only black family in town, and so they'd had to put up with a lot of harassment. Some of Jasmine's classmates had been cool. but some of the others... Jasmine was just glad that she was out of there now. Her parents had talked for years about leaving; the only reason they were still there was because her dad had a great job that he couldn't afford to leave. This town she was in now, it wasn't all sunshine and roses... but it was a lot better than her hometown. She occasionally ran into harassment, but she didn't feel like a pariah here. But the thought of being Kim, of being percieved of white, of being free of all of that bigotry and hatred, all the overt and subtle discrimination, of being percieved not as a black girl but just as a girl... it made her feel a little guilty to think about it, but it was a pretty nice thought.

But then Jasmine turned around and saw Mr. Fredericks staring at her butt, and she felt uncomfortable all over again.

Jasmine's steps slowed as she jogged around the next corner. Not because she was feeling tired... Kim's endurance was still keeping up. But Jasmine had some new stuff to think about. Maybe being Kim for the rest of her life... maybe it wouldn't be so bad. Being beautiful and rich and popular and on track toward a great career, and being free of a lifetime of discrimination... it definitely wouldn't be a bad deal if they couldn't find the remote and Jasmine had to stay as Kim. She felt a little sorry for the real Kim, but she believed she was Danny now, so Jasmine was sure she wouldn't mind. And Danny... well, Danny was a hot college girl now. He had the glamorous life he apparently wanted. And if he didn't feel comfortable being a woman... well, he'd gotten himself into this situation, hadn't he?

Yeah... she had a lot to think about...

12433212212221122122.content:
Dion Martin sorted through his haul from the previous night, sifting out the contents of his pockets on the kitchen table. Three credit cards; a gold pocketwatch; a decent stack of bills, including a hundred; a couple of cell phones; a diamond necklace. Not too shabby for one night's work. He was sure he could make some decent cash off this stuff.

And then there was the strangest item: the remote control. The remote looked like a normal remote control at first glance... one of those universal deals that controlled your TV and DVD player and stereo. Taking a closer look at the buttons, though, Dion had been surprised to see that, instead of the usual channel and volume controls, the remote had buttons that were labeled things like "World Swap" and "Face"... he had no idea what any of them were supposed to do, but one thing was clear: this was no TV remote.

He'd lifted it off that fine sister named Jasmine. Dion had spotted her the moment he'd walked into the club, and he hadn't been able to keep his eyes off her after that. Her luscious curves, her gorgeous eyes, her sweet ebony skin... she was just what Dion wanted in a woman. He'd thought for a while about just trying to pick her up and take her home, but he'd been on a mission last night. His rent was due in a week, and he was running pretty low on funds.

Dion wasn't proud of what he did for a living. He didn't want to be a thief. As a kid, he'd had dreams of being an artist, and as a teenager, he'd settled on being an architect. Good, honest work. But then his mom had gotten sick and he'd had to drop out of school to take care of her. Then there had been the alcohol and the drugs, the fights and the arrests. When his mom had passed away, he'd been so hurt, so angry at the whole wide world. And then there'd been the leg he'd hurt, the limp he was still living with now. And then the recession had hit, and it was so hard for EVERYONE to find a job. And of course, there were all the racist SOBs who just plain refused to hire a black man... it didn't matter what the reason was.

So Dion had been without a job. For a long, long time. And his unemployment had run out long ago. So what was he supposed to do? He had to have money to eat, right? And to pay his rent. And, of course, to show his ladies a good time.

Like that girl Jasmine. She'd turned out to be a pretty strange girl... she looked so feminine, moved so feminine, but then when Dion had gone up to talk to her, she'd seemed so... manly? Was that it? Not quite, but definitely not ladylike. And she'd been so friendly at first, but then when Dion had started touching her, started kissing her neck, she'd freaked out, like she'd never ever been touched by a man before. When Dion had asked, she'd said of course, she'd had lots of boyfriends, and she'd had sex with all of them, she swore. She said she just wasn't interested in dating for now. Amd when Dion had asked why she was at a club and why she was dressed so sexy if she didn't want a man, she hadn't had an answer.

Bitch.

Whatever. At least Dion had scored something off her. He just wished he knew what it did...

Dion looked it over, turned it over in his hands, scanned all the buttons. It was such a wierd little remote. He'd never seen anything like it. It didn't even have a battery panel or a power button. What was it for?

Experimentally, he pressed one of the buttons at random... "Physical Swap." Suddenly, a row of buttons lit up. He pushed the lit-up button closest to his thumb, which happened to be "Gender Swap." Nothing more happened.

Was that it?

He aimed the remote at the TV, which was tuned to a music video station. Right now there was a Beyonce video on, and Beyonce was shaking her booty on the beach in a tiny bikini. He pushed the remote, not expecting anything to happen.

Suddenly the picture on the TV changed. At first, Dion thought it was just a cut in the video, but then he realized that the wong itself had changed, too. It had the same melody, and the words were still talking about summer and the beach... but it was a man's voice singing now. And the screen... the singer was a buff black man in swimming trunks, and he was surrounded by girls dancing in bikinis on the beach. As the song faded out, the credits in the corner of the screen said the song was by "Matt Knowles" instead of Beyonce, and the song was called "Summer Girls" instead of "Summer Boy."

"What the heck?" Dion said... and then he stopped, startled by his voice. "Hello? Testing? One, two, three..." No doubt about it... he wasn't speaking in his usual smooth baritone. It was a woman's voice he was hearing. Dion jumped to his feet in shock... and that was when he realized that his whole body had changed.

Dion looked down at his body, amazed at what he was looking at. Instead of his fit, masculine body, he was now in the body of a woman. His legs were long and shapely; his arms were slender; his hands were delicate; his hips were curvy, and a large pair of breasts pushed out against the fabric of his shirt. And his shirt... instead of the t-shirt and jeans he'd been wearing, he was dressed in a tight black tank top and a tiny pair of denim shorts that were definitely made for a woman. He had bracelets on his wrists and a necklace on his neck, and his fingernails were painted a dark shade of crimson.

"What in the world?" Dion whispered in the same strange high-pitched voice.

A mirror. He needed a mirror. He ran out of the kitchen to the living room... and then he stopped in his tracks. The whole decor of his apartment had changed. The shape of the room was the same, so he knew it was the same apartment, but instead of his sophisticated black furniture, the futniture was all white and there were purple throw pillows on the couch and a purple rug on the floor. Where his picture of Malcolm X had been, there was now a picture of Denzel Washington... and not Denzel as Malcolm X, but Denzel posing shirtless. And instead of his sports memorabilia, Dion saw a shelf full of dolls.

His head was spinning. Staggering blindly to the bathroom, he flipped on the lightswitch and looked in the mirror... and he was absolutely amazed by what he saw. Looking back at him, Dion saw one of the most amazingly beautiful women he'd ever seen. She put that Jasmine chick to shame, no question. She had a perfect body, a perfect face, perfect eyes, perfect lips, perfect brown skin... her perfect hair hung in curls over his perfect shoulders.

Was that him? Was that what Dion looked like now? He looked in awe at his reflection... and he realized he was getting a little turned on by it. But instead of the familiar stirring in his pants, he felt his nipples harden... and at that point, he lost it. He fell against the wall and slid slowly down to a sitting position, and his eyes glazed over in complete and utter shock.

After a couple of moments of blank, mindless staring, Dion looked down at the remote in his hands. Had the remote done this? It must have. Gender swap... and it had done just that. It had swapped his gender with Beyonce's. It had turned Beyonce Knowles into Matt Knowles, and it had turned him into... into... well, whoever he was now. The woman he would have been if he'd been born a girl, Dion supposed. And man, what a woman he was...

If the remote could do this, what else could it do? He looked down at the huge array of buttons... and slowly realized the power he held in his hands. With this remote, he could do anything he wanted. He could finally make his life whatever he wanted it to be. He'd been coasting for so long... with this remote, he could finally take control of his life.

But first, he wanted to test it again. Pushing himself to his feet, he went back to the kitchen, where the TV was still playing the music video channel. Christina Aguilera was on the screen now, wearing a tiny silver minidress and silver-colored heels. Dion looked down at the remote. Probably best to start small, he though. He pointed the remote at the TV and pushed the "Clothing Swap" button. Suddenly, Christina Aguilera was wearing the tank top and shorts Dion had been wearing a moment ago. She also had the same black hair Dion used to have. Looking down at his body, Dion saw he was wearing Christina Aguilera's silver dress and high-heeled shoes, which fit his body perfectly and showed off his curves for all they were worth, as well as Christina's long bleach blonde hair.

Yeah... yeah, this remote was going to change his life, Dion thought. But first things first, he wanted to turn himself back into a dude again.

Or did he? Being a woman had its possibilities. Especially a woman as hot as he was now. He knew the kinds of advantages hot women had. They could seduce men to get what they wanted. Flirt their way out of trouble. And while everyone was suspicious of a black man, people wouldn't suspect a woman of the kinds of crimes Dion had been forced to commit to get by. Dion could put this body to work for him. Maybe he would have a better life as a woman... maybe that was the first step. But was he comfortable living as a woman if it meant a better life?
